message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you an incredible opportunity to acquire a unique and valuable product. I believe this product will bring significant benefits to your business and I'm willing to make a competitive offer. I'm offering the product to you for $2000000.
I'm very interested in the product, but $2000000 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $1800000 for it. Is this a price you'd be willing to accept?

I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. However, I was hoping to get closer to my initial price. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $1900000. This is the lowest I can go, and I believe it's still a fair price for the value the product will bring to your business.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $1700000 for the product. Is this a price you'd be willing to accept?

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting too far apart. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my target price. I'm counteroffering at $1850000. This is as low as I can go, and I think it's still a fair price for the product's value.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $1750000 for the product. Is this a price you'd be willing to accept?
